Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which defines the Player type
    Author:
    Andru

      java.lang.String playerType)
        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • getCharacter

        public char getCharacter()
        Getter method for player's character
        Returns:
        returns player's character

      • makeHumanMove

        private void makeHumanMove(Board board)
        Method for performing an action (a move) as a human player. Read action from input, if correct execute, otherwise read action again until success.
        Parameters:
        board - board on which we are acting

      • makeAIMove

        private void makeAIMove(Board board)
        Method for performing an action (a move) as an AI player. This is implementation just makes a random move.
        Parameters:
        board - board on which we are acting

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Board board)
        Method for performing an action, whether it is done by a human or an AI player
        Parameters:
        board - board on which we are acting

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Player p)
        Method used to test if 2 players are equal (they use the same character). Warning! This is equals method is not "politically correct". There is an equals method in the Object class which has the signature: boolean equals(Object o). That is the method we should have implemented (overwritten). However, considering that we are always comparing players among themselves, there is no reason to complicate this (especially since inheritance and overwritting methods is not clear at this point).
        Parameters:
        p - player which we are comparing with this player
        Returns:
        returns true if player p is equal to this player, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return string representation for this player. In this case, just the character he is using
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
